Welcome to Scroll Circus!
First, let\'s find out how lucky you are! Please press the life button!
Life Button
Now try to allocate your resources properly to create a circus!
Points left:
Foundation
Add budget for tent, seating, lighting etc. (Cost: 25)
Add professional knowledge of acts and tricks (Cost: 20)
Employees
Add ringmaster, clowns, mimes etc. (Cost: 20)
Add acrobats, jugglers, stilt-walkers etc. (Cost: 15)
Add strongmen, trapeze artists etc. (Cost: 15)
Add contortionists, escape artists etc. (Cost: 10)
Extras
Add custard pies, snacks and beverages (Cost: 10)
Add a gift shop (Cost: 10)
Add animals and animal trainers (Cost: 5)
Add a freak show (Cost: 5)
Create Circus
New Circus Comes to Town
The recent circus event impressed even the most sceptical spectators!
Unfortunately, the recent circus event was far from extraordinary.
It was an amateur initiative due to the lack of facilities.
Everyone could enjoy themselves thanks to the comfortable and beautiful facilities.
The acts were poorly performed and some spectators asked for a refund.
The entire event and the acts kept everyone on the edge of their seats.
The acts were inadequately coordinated and, quite unexpectedly, there were no clowns.
The ringmaster as well as the clowns and mimes kept the audience entertained through the entire event.
Despite, the audience\'s expectations, there were no caution and balance-related performances.
The acrobats, jugglers and stilt-walkers added a brilliant variety to the entire show.
There were no strongmen or trapeze artists, performers any professional should include in the show.
The strongmen and trapeze artists impressed the audience with their stamina.
The initiative was at a disadvantage compared to its competitors due to the lack of contortionists and escape artists.
The initiative included multiple flexibility and escape acts rendering the event worthwhile.
Unfortunately, there were no snacks and beverages offered in the beginning and in-between the acts.
The audience appreciated the availability of snacks and beverages in the beginning and in-between the acts.
The event coordinator did not include a gift shop to increase earnings after the show.
People had the option to purchase gifts after the show, something that helped spread the circus\'s reputation.
No complaints were phrased about the lack animals and animal trainers in the performance.
The circus was held by professionals and everyone admired the variety the animal-related acts added to the entire event.
Many spectators considered the event an opportunity for amateurs to abuse animals.
There was certainly no freak show included in the event, and no spectator appeared unsatisfied about this.
As for the freak show, it was also perceived positively, probably due to the circus\'s admirable reputation.
As for the freak show, it undermined the entire show as it was considered largely anachronistic.
Overall, it is broadly agreed that there has never been a circus so brilliant until now.
Overall, it is broadly agreed there is still room for improvement for the new circus.
